result.execSummary:
The defendant Deldemontea D Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deldemontea D Bell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deldemontea D Bell was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

supervisions.notes: Consec to any other sentences.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

Defendant in court with Attorney Eric Schulenburg.  Shelly Rusch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - RE-REFERRAL TO BMP
- The court orders the defendant be released on a Signature Bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM no later than 10:00 A.M. on Friday, 03-20-15. If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2,500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Ray C. or Francisco A.
- Defendant shall be within his residence (his Mother's home only) between the hours of 7 p.m. and 7 a.m. unless accompanied by a parent, legal guardian or grandparent, unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Trial Judge -  Br 1
